dailyPriceChange.name: Micron Technology, Inc.
dailyPriceChange.news: Micron’s rally is being driven by booming demand and pricing for AI memory—especially high‑bandwidth memory (HBM) used in Nvidia and AMD accelerators—which has fueled sharp sales and earnings growth. The company says its AI memory supply is sold out through 2026 and it can meet only about 60% of near‑term demand, prompting capacity expansions via new plants and acquisitions. Recent results included fiscal 2025 revenue of $37.4 billion and adjusted EPS of $8.29, with Q1 revenue up 56.6% year over year to $13.6 billion and EPS of $4.78.

dailyPriceChange.name: Palantir Technologies Inc.
dailyPriceChange.news: Palantir’s 3.45% drop appears tied to renewed valuation concerns and a broader rotation out of software/AI stocks; the company’s shares are down about 17% from their recent high despite a massive multi-year run. Wall Street is split—bulls cite strong AI-platform execution and results, while bears warn the premium valuation is hard to justify—adding pressure to the stock.
